alert.note: Alert for Custer; Dewey (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 11 at 4:34AM CDT until July 11 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Dewey County in northwestern Oklahoma... Custer County in western Oklahoma... * Until 700 AM CDT. * At 434 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Weatherford, Thomas, Arapaho, Leedey, Custer City, Butler, Putnam, Fay and Moorewood. The heaviest rain has occurred from Putnam and Thomas. down to Weatherford. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
